member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.AccordionButton
member.summary: Represents the header for an accordion item.
member.remarks: By creating a seperate control, there is more flexibility in the templating possibilities.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.AccordionButton.ParentAccordionItem
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to the parent AccordionItem of an AccordionButton.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.AccordionButton.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.AccordionButton.AccentBrush
member.summary: Gets or sets the accent brush

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.AccordionButton.OnMouseEnter(System.Windows.Input.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Occurs when the focus is obtained

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.AccordionButton.OnMouseLeave(System.Windows.Input.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Occurs when the focus is lost

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.AccordionButton.UpdateVisualState(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the state of the visual.
member.param: If set to true use transitions.
member.remarks: The header will follow the parent accordionitem states.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.AccordionSelectionMode
member.summary: Defines the minimum and maximum number of selected items allowed in an Accordion control.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.AccordionSelectionMode.One
member.summary: Exactly one item must be selected in the Accordion.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.AccordionSelectionMode.OneOrMore
member.summary: At least one item must be selected in the Accordion.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.AccordionSelectionMode.ZeroOrOne
member.summary: No more than one item can be selected in the accordion.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.AccordionSelectionMode.ZeroOrMore
member.summary: Any number of items can be selected in the Accordion.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.AccordionAction
member.summary: Determines the action the AccordionItem will perform.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.AccordionAction.None
member.summary: No action will be performed.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.AccordionAction.Collapse
member.summary: A collapse will be performed.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.AccordionAction.Expand
member.summary: An expand will be performed.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.AccordionAction.Resize
member.summary: A resize will be performed.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl
member.summary: Represents a control with a single piece of content that expands or collapses in a sliding motion to a specified desired size.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl._clippingRectangle
member.summary: The Geometry used to clip this control. The control will potentially have less available space than the content it is arranging. That part will be clipped.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.ElementContentSiteName
member.summary: The name of the ContentSite template part.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl._contentSite
member.summary: BackingField for the ContentSite property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.ContentSite
member.summary: Gets or sets the ContentSite template part.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.Percentage
member.summary: Gets or sets the relative percentage of the content that is currently visible. A percentage of 1 corresponds to the complete TargetSize.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.PercentageProperty
member.summary: Identifies the Percentage dependency property.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.OnPercentagePropertyChanged(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: PercentageProperty property changed handler.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.TargetSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired size of the ExpandableContentControl content.
member.remarks: Use the percentage property to animate to this size.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.TargetSizeProperty
member.summary: Identifies the TargetSize dependency property.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.OnTargetSizePropertyChanged(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: TargetSizeProperty property changed handler.

member.name: E:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.ContentSizeChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the content changed its size.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.MeasureOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Does a measure pass of the control and its content. The content will get measured according to the TargetSize and is clipped.
member.param: The available size that this object can give to child objects. Infinity can be specified as a value to indicate that the object will size to whatever content is available.
member.returns: The size that this object determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of child object allotted sizes.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.MeasureContent(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Measures the content with a specific size.
member.param: The size passed to the content.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.CalculateDesiredContentSize
member.summary: Interprets TargetSize.
member.returns: A size that can be safely used to measure content.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.ArrangeOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Arranges the control and its content. Content is arranged according to the TargetSize and clipped.
member.param: The final area within the parent that this object should use to arrange itself and its children.
member.returns: The actual size used.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.UpdateClip(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Updates the clip geometry.
member.param: Size of the visible part of the control.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.RecalculatePercentage(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Recalculates the percentage based on a new size.
member.param: The new size used to base percentages on.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.SetRevealDimension
member.summary: Sets the dimensions according to the current percentage.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.SetNonRevealDimension
member.summary: Sets the opposite dimension.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.RelevantContentSize
member.summary: Gets the content current visible size.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.OnApplyTemplate
member.summary: Builds the visual tree for the ExpandableContentControl control when a new template is applied.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.OnContentSiteSizeChanged(System.Object,System.Windows.SizeChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the ContentSizeChanged event.
member.param: The SizeChangedEventArgs instance containing the event data.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.Dispose
member.summary: Represents dispose method for disposing unwanted objects

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ExpandableContentControl.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: To remove all the instance which is used in ExpandableContentControl

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.InteractionHelper
member.summary: The InteractionHelper provides controls with support for all of the common interactions like mouse movement, mouse clicks, key presses, etc., and also incorporates proper event semantics when the control is disabled.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.InteractionHelper.SequentialClickThresholdInMilliseconds
member.summary: The threshold used to determine whether two clicks are temporally local and considered a double click (or triple, quadruple, etc.). 500 milliseconds is the default double click value on Windows. This value would ideally be pulled form the system settings.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.InteractionHelper.SequentialClickThresholdInPixelsSquared
member.summary: The threshold used to determine whether two clicks are spatially local and considered a double click (or triple, quadruple, etc.) in pixels squared. We use pixels squared so that we can compare to the distance delta without taking a square root.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.InteractionHelper.Control
member.summary: Gets the control the InteractionHelper is targeting.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.InteractionHelper.IsFocused
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the control has focus.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.InteractionHelper.IsMouseOver
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the mouse is over the control.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.InteractionHelper.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the read-only property is set.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.InteractionHelper.IsPressed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the mouse button is pressed down over the control.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.InteractionHelper.LastClickTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the last time the control was clicked.
member.remarks: The value is stored as Utc time because it is slightly more performant than converting to local time.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.InteractionHelper.LastClickPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the mouse position of the last click.
member.remarks: The value is relative to the control.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.InteractionHelper.ClickCount
member.summary: Gets the number of times the control was clicked.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.InteractionHelper._updateVisualState
member.summary: Reference used to call UpdateVisualState on the base class.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.InteractionHelper.#ctor(System.Windows.Controls.Control)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the InteractionHelper class.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.InteractionHelper.UpdateVisualState(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Update the visual state of the control.
member.param: A value indicating whether to automatically generate transitions to the new state, or instantly transition to the new state.
member.remarks: UpdateVisualState works differently than the rest of the injected functionality. Most of the other events are overridden by the calling class which calls Allow, does what it wants, and then calls Base. UpdateVisualState is the opposite because a number of the methods in InteractionHelper need to trigger it in the calling class. We do this using the IUpdateVisualState internal interface.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.InteractionHelper.UpdateVisualStateBase(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Update the visual state of the control.
member.param: A value indicating whether to automatically generate transitions to the new state, or instantly transition to the new state.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.InteractionHelper.OnLoaded(System.Object,System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs)
member.summary: Handle the control's Loaded event.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.InteractionHelper.OnIsEnabledChanged(System.Object,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Handle changes to the control's IsEnabled property.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.InteractionHelper.OnIsReadOnlyChanged(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Handles changes to the control's IsReadOnly property.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.InteractionHelper.OnApplyTemplateBase
member.summary: Update the visual state of the control when its template is changed.

member.summary: Check if the control's GotFocus event should be handled.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the event should be handled.

member.summary: Base implementation of the virtual GotFocus event handler.

member.summary: Check if the control's LostFocus event should be handled.

member.summary: Base implementation of the virtual LostFocus event handler.

member.summary: Base implementation of the virtual MouseEnter event handler.

member.summary: Base implementation of the virtual MouseLeftButtonUp event handler.

member.summary: Translates keys for proper RightToLeft mode support.
member.returns: A translated key code, indicating how the original key should be interpreted.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ItemsControlHelper
member.summary: The ItemContainerGenerator provides useful utilities for ItemsControls.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ItemsControlHelper.ItemsControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the ItemsControl being tracked by the ItemContainerGenerator.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ItemsControlHelper._itemsHost
member.summary: A Panel that is used as the ItemsHost of the ItemsControl. This property will only be valid when the ItemsControl is live in the tree and has generated containers for some of its items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ItemsControlHelper.ItemsHost
member.summary: Gets a Panel that is used as the ItemsHost of the ItemsControl. This property will only be valid when the ItemsControl is live in the tree and has generated containers for some of its items.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ItemsControlHelper._scrollHost
member.summary: A ScrollViewer that is used to scroll the items in the ItemsHost.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ItemsControlHelper.ScrollHost
member.summary: Gets a ScrollViewer that is used to scroll the items in the ItemsHost.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ItemsControlHelper.#ctor(System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ItemContainerGenerator.
member.param: The ItemsControl being tracked by the ItemContainerGenerator.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ItemsControlHelper.OnApplyTemplate
member.summary: Apply a control template to the ItemsControl.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ItemsControlHelper.PrepareContainerForItemOverride(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.Style)
member.summary: Prepares the specified container to display the specified item.
member.param: Container element used to display the specified item.
The ItemContainerStyle for the parent ItemsControl.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ItemsControlHelper.UpdateItemContainerStyle(System.Windows.Style)
member.summary: Update the style of any generated items when the ItemContainerStyle has been changed.
member.remarks: Silverlight does not support setting a Style multiple times, so we only attempt to set styles on elements whose style hasn't already been set.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.ItemsControlHelper.ScrollIntoView(System.Windows.FrameworkElement)
member.summary: Scroll the desired element into the ScrollHost's viewport.

member.summary: Changes the selected item, by unselecting and selecting where necessary.

member.summary: Called when selected items collection changed.

member.summary: Called when selected indices collection changed.
member.param: The instance containing the event data.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.SfAccordion.ProposeSelectedIndexCandidate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an item that is suitable for selection.
member.param: Index that should not be considered if possible.
member.returns: An item that should be selected. This could be nonCandidateIndex, if no other possibility was found.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.SfAccordion.SelectAll
member.summary: Selects all the AccordionItems in the Accordion control.
member.remarks: If the Accordion SelectionMode is OneOrMore or ZeroOrMore all AccordionItems would be selected. If the Accordion SelectionMode is One or ZeroOrOne all items would be selected and unselected. Only the last AccordionItem would remain selected.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.SfAccordion.UnselectAll
member.summary: Unselects all the AccordionItems in the Accordion control.
member.remarks: If the Accordion SelectionMode is Zero or ZeroOrMore all AccordionItems would be Unselected. If SelectionMode is One or OneOrMode than all items would be Unselected and selected. Only the first AccordionItem would still be selected.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.SfAccordion.UpdateAccordionItemsSelection(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates all accordionItems to be selected or unselected.
member.param: True to select all items, false to unselect.
member.remarks: Will not attempt to change a locked accordionItem.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.SfAccordion.SetLockedProperties
member.summary: Sets the locked properties on all the items.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.SfAccordion.RaiseOnSelectedItemsCollectionChanged(System.Collections.Specialized.NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Raise the SelectedItemsCollectionChanged event.
member.param: The instance containing the event data.
member.remarks: This event is raised after the changes to the collection have been processed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.SfAccordionItem.IsLocked
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the AccordionItem cannot be selected by the user.
member.value: True if this instance is locked; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The IsSelected property may not be changed when the AccordionItem is locked. Locking occurs when the item is the first in the list, the SelectionMode of Accordion requires atleast one selected AccordionItem and the AccordionItem is currently selected.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.VisualStates.GoToState(System.Windows.Controls.Control,System.Boolean,System.String[])
member.summary: Use VisualStateManager to change the visual state of the control.
member.param: Control whose visual state is being changed.
A value indicating whether to use transitions when updating the visual state, or to snap directly to the new visual state.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.VisualStates.TryGetVisualStateGroup(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.String)
member.summary: This method tries to get the named VisualStateGroup for the dependency object. The provided object's ImplementationRoot will be looked up in this call.
member.returns: Returns null or the VisualStateGroup object.

member.summary: Represents a control that applies a layout transformation to its Content.

member.summary: Name of the TransformRoot template part.

member.summary: Name of the Presenter template part.

member.summary: Gets or sets the layout transform to apply on the LayoutTransformer control content.
member.remarks: Corresponds to UIElement.LayoutTransform.

member.summary: Identifies the LayoutTransform DependencyProperty.

member.summary: Gets the child element being transformed.

member.summary: Acceptable difference between two doubles.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.LayoutTransformer.DecimalsAfterRound
member.summary: Number of decimals to round the Matrix to.

member.summary: Root element for performing transformations.

member.summary: ContentPresenter element for displaying the content.

member.summary: RenderTransform/MatrixTransform applied to _transformRoot.

member.summary: Transformation matrix corresponding to _matrixTransform.

member.summary: Actual DesiredSize of Child element (the value it returned from its MeasureOverride method).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LayoutTransformer class.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.LayoutTransformer.OnApplyTemplate
member.summary: Builds the visual tree for the LayoutTransformer control when a new template is applied.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.LayoutTransformer.LayoutTransformChanged(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles changes to the Transform DependencyProperty.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.LayoutTransformer.ApplyLayoutTransform
member.summary: Applies the layout transform on the LayoutTransformer control content.
member.remarks: Only used in advanced scenarios (like animating the LayoutTransform). Should be used to notify the LayoutTransformer control that some aspect of its Transform property has changed.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.LayoutTransformer.ProcessTransform(System.Windows.Media.Transform)
member.summary: Processes the Transform to determine the corresponding Matrix.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.LayoutTransformer.GetTransformMatrix(System.Windows.Media.Transform)
member.summary: Walks the Transform(Group) and returns the corresponding Matrix.
member.returns: Computed Matrix.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.LayoutTransformer.MeasureOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Provides the behavior for the "Measure" pass of layout.
member.param: The available size that this element can give to child elements.
member.returns: The size that this element determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of child element sizes.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.LayoutTransformer.ArrangeOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Provides the behavior for the "Arrange" pass of layout.
member.param: The final area within the parent that this element should use to arrange itself and its children.
member.returns: The actual size used.
member.remarks: Using the WPF paramater name finalSize instead of Silverlight's finalSize for clarity

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.LayoutTransformer.ComputeLargestTransformedSize(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Compute the largest usable size (greatest area) after applying the transformation to the specified bounds.
member.returns: Largest Size possible.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.LayoutTransformer.IsSizeSmaller(System.Windows.Size,System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Returns true if Size a is smaller than Size b in either dimension.
member.returns: True if Size a is smaller than Size b in either dimension.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.LayoutTransformer.RoundMatrix(System.Windows.Media.Matrix,System.Int32)
member.summary: Rounds the non-offset elements of a Matrix to avoid issues due to floating point imprecision.
member.param: Number of decimal places to round to.
member.returns: Rounded Matrix.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.LayoutTransformer.RectTransform(System.Windows.Rect,System.Windows.Media.Matrix)
member.summary: Implements WPF's Rect.Transform on Silverlight.
member.returns: Bounding box of transformed Rect.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Windows.Controls.Layout.LayoutTransformer.MatrixMultiply(System.Windows.Media.Matrix,System.Windows.Media.Matrix)
member.summary: Implements WPF's Matrix.Multiply on Silverlight.
member.returns: Multiplication result.

member.summary: Implements WPF's Matrix.HasInverse on Silverlight.
member.returns: True if the Matrix has an inverse.
